results.description: Want to learn more about the OpenTechSchool? Or want to contribute or discuss potential ideas, and even start planning them with us? Then join OTS organisers this Thursday evening, at 9p.m. as we head to Trödler Bar for good discussions, planning and drinks!
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be most likely in the back of the bar where the old cinema chairs are
results.name: OpenTechSchool Drinks

results.description:
Come together to hack together on your own stuff.

Every Saturday afternoon can be your dedicated project time. Be it your work from the week, the pet project, your new start-up or

the next lessons on codeacademy - sit down and get cracking. Why not do that at home? Because this will be a hangout for all kinds of people and so you can chat in your breaks, get to know new people and help each other out when you're stuck.

Although it's announced on our meetup group a few things to note about this meetup:

It's not guaranteed you'll have a OTS member/coach present. There won't be any prepared talks or workshops. There are other people and music, too. Also the WIFI is flaky sometimes. We are offering this as an easier way to meet other learners. Please ping us if you have suggestions to make this event more useful to you all.

The first one to come, put up a paper easily visible for everyone, stating that there is the OTS Learners hangout so that others can find you.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet in the café downstairs, Look for some friendly people with laptops.
results.name: Learners hangout

results.description:
This is a Javascript Learning group meeting up every Wednesday.

Bring your laptop and the project that you are working on and there, there will be some coaches whom ask and able to help, but we also learn from each other.

You can already see from the RSVP List who are the coaches and contact them directly.

The target is beginners/medium, people that are just approaching Javascript are welcome to come, discover and try out as well as who are further or just have specific questions and/or need help with Javascript related topics.


Please note there will be no talks, no lesson, just people love coding together and keep learning :)


If you don't have any project in mind or anything currently working on, don't worry,there are already materials made for the Javascript beginners workshop which is free and open. You can have a look here:
>Day1 -
>Day2 Maybe you can also help us to improve the material! ;)
results.how_to_find_us: 5th floor - If the gate is close try the small one. Get inside of the backyard and than turn left (block in the middle)
results.name: Js OTS Learners Group

results.description: OpenTechSchool will officially take over the hosting and organisation of IT-Labs Berlin and kicks it off together with Technologie Stiftung Berlin, the Freien Universität Berlin, the Technischen Universität Berlin, the Hochschule für Wirtschaft und Technik, KDAB Deutschland and Immobilienscout24. You want to learn more about the event, what IT-Labs is and does and what the future at OpenTechSchool will bring it,

>please refer to this blog post.


This event will be in German only (it's an official thing).

Schedule (german):

15:30 Uhr Ankommen
15:45 Uhr Begrüßung
16:00 Uhr Vorträge (Themen: Informatikdidaktik, Nachwuchsförderung im MINT-Bereich, außerschulische Angebote, Schülerlabore)
17:00 Uhr Networking und Ausstellung (diverse Projekte, sowie freie Lehr- und Lernmaterialien)
17:30 Uhr geplantes Ende der Veranstaltung
>Please see this blog post for all the details and if you'd like to join please also
>RSVP via this form.
results.name: IT-Labs Kick-off

results.description:

results.name: Learners hangout

results.description: This is a work group of python learners, meeting up every other week to continue learning on python. As always there will be experienced Python Coaches around but we also just learn from each other. You can just check the RSVP-List for people tagged

and feel free to contact any of them directly at the event.

This group is open to total beginners in programming, who want to learn python, as well as to people, who are further or just have specific questions and/or need help with python related topics. Please don't forget to bring your own laptop.

The
>OpenTechSchool Python Coaches release all their learning material at
>learn.opentechschool.org. Feel free to take a look.
results.how_to_find_us: We are in the 3rd or 5th floor, please check the signs
results.name: Continuous Python Learning Group

results.name: Js OTS Learners Group

results.description:
It's never been easier to make video games, thanks to the multitude of resources available and a growing worldwide community willing to help beginners. As a result, new games are being released every day, exploring different directions and tackling novel themes: playing is more stimulating and inclusive than ever.

Talk & Play is a bi-monthly meetup whose goal is to give a better idea of what it's like to create and play games today, providing the opportunity to local independent game makers to showcase their work in a friendly and relaxed environment. Everybody's welcome, whatever their background and knowledge level. If you like video games, we'll make sure you have a good time!

The event is split into two parts:

1. TALK: 2/3 short game-related talks (5 to 15 minutes), followed by a Q&A session – it's all about sharing knowledge.

2. PLAY: games made or chosen by the speakers will be shown; in addition, all participants are welcome to bring games they've made or are still working on – a perfect opportunity to discover and play new games, collect feedback and maybe find collaborators.

To give you a better idea of what you're going to find, check out the summaries of the previous Talk & Play:
>#1,
>#2,
>#3,

>#4

The Talk & Play #5 speakers will be:

—

>Pedro Lopes, a PhD student of Prof. Patrick Baudisch's Human Computer Interaction lab in Hasso Plattner Institut, Berlin. Pedro investigates the future of interfaces, such as muscle-interfaces. A believer on the unification of art and research, often gives talks about it [BodyControlled, Campus Party 2013]. Makes and writes music using turntables [in eitr] and writes about music too [in

>jazz.pt magazine].


Talk Abstract: Muscle-Propelled Games: playing games through our bodies

Our research points out that

is the next step for increased realism in human computer interfaces, and a way of creating very small mobile devices. For a long time, the key to immersion in interactive experience and games was sought in photorealistic graphics. Now, interfaces and games became more immersive by requiring us to physically enact, such as with Wii or Kinect. With graphics and user interaction now part of many games, many researchers argue that haptics and motion are the next step towards increasing realism. However, when it comes to output, we have nothing more than vibrating buzzers, such as the ones that make our smartphones vibrate. In this talk, we show compelling new ultra-mobile technologies that provide exciting haptic feedback. Our approaches achieve a low hardware footprint by leveraging use our own muscle power! We will demonstrate several projects that allow for interaction to become more immersive.
>More info |

>Video preview


—
>Sjors Houkes has supported starting game studios for years at

>Dutch Game Garden, by organising network events, festivals and game jams. He wants to get good at making games himself, but for the moment is way more capable as a professional voice actor.

— Giles Coope, Javier Díaz and Raphaël de Courville teamed up for the second year in a row to create a game during the Global Game Jam in Berlin. The result was

>にゃんこわん (Nyanko-Wan), a kawaii local multiplayer crowd game meant to be played by cats. They will tell us more about its development and then we're all (=all people with a touch screen device) going to play the game together.

On top of this,
>Lorenzo will talk a bit about

>A MAZE. / Berlin 2014 which is going to take place on April 9-11 – he's involved in the organisation of the festival and uses every available opportunity to promote it. By the way: have you bought a ticket already? Have you submitted your game for the awards?

>The deadline is February 15!

During the Play part of the evening some of the games made during the

>Global Game Jam Berlin 2014 will be shown, but as always all participants are invited to bring their own creations.

Would you like to give a talk as well in the future? Then

>get in touch!


Talk & Play is organised in collaboration with the monthly
>Berlin Mini Game Jam and
>A MAZE.
results.name: Talk & Play #5

results.description:
Every 4 weeks on Thursday the Berlin OpenTechSchool organising team meets over breakfast (bring your own).

Everyone willing to suggest, discuss or contribute to the organisation of an OpenTechSchool event is welcome.

Note: we also host OpenTechSchool Drinks every 4 weeks on Thursday evenings (2 weeks after/before the Organisers Breakfast).
results.name: Organisers Breakfast

results.description:
Want to learn more about the OpenTechSchool? Or want to contribute or discuss potential ideas, and even start planning them with us? Then join us for drinks every 4 weeks on Thursday evening.

The OpenTechSchool organisers will meet at 7:30p.m. at Co.up -- if you feel like contributing to that too you are welcome -- and then at 9p.m. we'll head for more discussions, planning and drinks in a bar or a park near Kottbusser Tor.

The specific location for those drinks will be different each time and decided a few days in advance and announced on this page.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be most likely in the back of the bar where the old cinema chairs are
results.name: OpenTechSchool Drinks

meta.title: Meetup Events v2
meta.description: Access Meetup events using a group, member, or event id. Events in private groups are available only to authenticated members of those groups. To search events by topic or location, see [Open Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/open_events).
